Class BotPlayer

java.lang.Object
Player
BotPlayer
public class BotPlayer extends Player
Extends the Player class to create a bot that can play the game autonomously.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Player

    board, location

  • Constructor Details

    • BotPlayer

      public BotPlayer(Board board)
      Constructor for the BotPlayer class. Has an additional board object to represent the bot's knowledge of the game board. Sets the bot's strategy randomly between chaser and looter.
      Parameters:
      board - - the game board

  • Method Details

    • getStrategy

      public String getStrategy()
      Get's the bot player's strategy
      Returns:
      String containing the strategy of the bot

    • decideAction

      public void decideAction()
      Determines the logic for the action that the bot will take Works using the concept of a target If the bot has no target, it will look to try to find one

    • getNewTarget

      public Location getNewTarget()
      Determines the bot's next target based on its strategy. Chasers will target a player's location if they have been seen, otherwise will move to a default target. Looters will target the nearest gold if they see any, otherwise will move to a default target. Looters will target the exit if they have enough gold to win the game.
      Returns:
      the Location of the bot's next target

    • findPath

      public String findPath(Location destination)
      Method to find a path to the target, if there is one on the bot's knownBoard - simple version of breadth first search Create a two dimensional array of strings. Each string reprsents the set of directions needed to get to that location from the bot's current location. Work outwards from the bot's current location, checking N, S, E and W directions from that location If the cell in that direction is reachable, append the direction required to reach it to the current location's string and store it in that cell If the location is the target, return the string of directions to get there Move on to the next location in the queue
      Parameters:
      destination - - the location to find a path to
      Returns:
      the String containing the set of directions to reach the target from the current location if the target is found, otherwise null

    • getDefaultTarget

      public Location getDefaultTarget()
      If no better target, try moving two squares in a random direction from the bot's current location. If the target is a wall, just get a random target within the current seen area that isn't a wall or the current square.
      Returns:
      the Location of the bot's default target

    • moveToTarget

      public void moveToTarget()
      Moves the bot to the target location via the path found by the findPath method. Move one turn at a time, removing the direction from the path String each time.
